New Goals

July 31, 2016

New Goals

After successfully defended my Master’s, i start to work in a project to apply as a PhD candidate at ICMC. After some meetings with my advisor, we came to a conclusion about the main goal of the project. We decide to investigate new software testing techiniques to apply in the context of programs that make use of Virtual Reality.

Since i don’t have backgroud in the area, in the first semester of 2017 i take an course at School of Arts, Sciences and Humanities of the University of São Paulo. The course (SIN5114 - Fundamentals of Graphic Processing) was taught by prof. PhD. Fátima L. S. Nunes.

In the course we saw a basic overview of image processing, computer graphics and virtual reality. During the course i developed some things that are avaliable in my github repository.

More specifically:

  • SIN5114 - A software that implements some fundamental filters used in image processing. The aim of this project is to develop a set of filters to help tasks related to digital image processing.

  • Java3DMutator - A proof of concept tool to visualize mutants generated for programs that use java3d lib.

In the future I hope to do other courses specifically focused on the context of virtual reality, so that I have more security regarding my new research project.
